awd_titl_txt: Workshop:   Community Building for Long Non-Coding RNA; Fall/Summer; Morgantown, WVA; Houston, TX
awd_abstract_narration:
The recent discovery that the human genome is extensively transcribed is changing our traditional view of gene regulation, and gene function. A significant part of this transcription involves long non-coding RNAs (LncRNAs). LncRNAs are known to function as RNA genes and are involved in various biological and cellular processes, such as genetic imprinting, chromatin remodeling, gene regulation in both plants and animals, and embryonic development in vertebrates. Not surprisingly, LncRNAs have been implicated in several difficult diseases, such as cancer, and diabetes. Although some individual LncRNAs have been well studied, their nature and functions are still not completely understood. Over 30,000 have been identified, with this number increasing daily. Thus, our ability to experimentally study individual LncRNAs and their functions in the wet-lab is far outpaced by the sheer volume and diversity of available data, and the increasing rate at which the data is being generated. There is an acute need for computational tools to simplify the process of characterizing the known LncRNAs to determine their functional associations. Yet, automated methods will undoubtedly generate an enormous number of hypotheses on the potential functions of a given lncRNA, far beyond the capacity of any individual wet laboratory to verify. This calls for a collaborative community-driven approach, where researchers from various fields will come together to address a critical problem. Several workshops will be organized, bringing together researchers interested in prioritizing issues of importance to furthering research in this area.

The aim of these workshop activities is to build a diverse community of scholars centered on the problem of functional annotation of LncRNAs, including LncRNA detection and data generation, and standardization of lncRNA nomenclature. Such a community will bring together computational scientists, molecular and structural biologists, medical scientists, and others, from academia,government, industry (especially healthcare and pharmaceutical industry), to focus on key issues in our improved understanding of LncRNAs and their functions. By creating public forums of the outcomes of discussions and activities, these workshops will raise awareness on key problems and challenges in studying the biology of in LncRNAs, their functions, and information sharing challenges such as annotation, and nomenclature standardization. A highly diverse community of researchers will be encouraged to participate, who could provide a novel perspective to these problems.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.

pgm_ref.pgm_ref_txt: EXP PROG TO STIM COMP RES

por.por_cntn:
Key outcomes:

 

(1) Community Building: 

Building a diverse community of scholars centered on problem in LncRNAs, including LncRNA detection, annotation, data generation, and standardization of LncRNA nomenclature. Brought together computational scientists, molecular/structural biologists, medical scientists, others, from academia, government, industry, to focus on key issues in LncRNAs, their functions, and implications in diseases and other applications. 

 

 

(2) Outreach Efforts:

Provided awareness on key problems in LncRNAs, their functions, annotation, and nomenclature standardization. Project helped in reach out to a diverse community, including known experts and leaders in the field, postdocs, graduate/undergraduate students, and disciplinary minorities.

 

 

For (1) and (2) above, organized a mailing list of over 30000 researchers related to LncRNAs.

 

 

 

(3) Established the IEEE BIBM LncRNA Workshop Series as a component of the respected annual IEEE BIBM conference, co-chaired by PI (Adjeroh), Co-PI (Zhou), (I. Martinez (WVU)), and L. Lipovich (Wayne State U (WSU)).  Held every December (2019--2024, 6 times in all). 

 

 

Workshop series has attracted renowned researchers in LncRNA from around the globe, as keynote, plenary, or invited speakers: 

 

 

2019: San Diego, CA, USA

 

Mauro Calabrese, Department of Pharmacology, University of North Carolina, Chapel Hill, NC

Keynote: K-mer based sequence comparison as a way to identify functional lncRNAs

 

 

Lynne Maquat, University of Rochester Medical Center, NY

Keynote: 3'UTR-Mediated Post-transcriptional Effects on Human Gene Expression via Staufen and SINEs

 

 

 

2020: South Korea + Online

 

John Rinn, University of Colorado, Boulder CO, USA

Keynote: Linking RNA to Chromatin

 

Rory Johnson, University of Bern, Switzerland

Keynote: Hunting for therapeutic long noncoding RNAs

 

Kaifu Chen, Boston Children’s Hospital.

Invited: Oncogenic lncRNA identification on the basis of epigenetic code

 

 

 

2021: Dubai, UAE + Online

 

George Calin, The University of Texas MD Anderson Cancer Center, Houston, TX, USA

Keynote: About Chomsky, patterns, non-codingRNAs and cancer therapy.

 

 

Thomas Derrien, University of Rennes 1, CNRS,  France.

Keynote: LncRNAs in domesticated animals.

 

 

Jeffrey A Loeb, Neurology, University of Illinois Chicago Medical Center.

Keynote: Deciphering roles for lncRNAs in human brain activity, disease, and death

 

 

Nadya Dimitrova, Yale University

Keynote: LncRNAs at the intersection of cancer pathways

 

 

Tatyana Shkurat, Dept. Genetics, Southern Federal University (SFU), Rostov-on-Don, Russia

Invited: GWAS and Genome Epidemiology OF LncRNA Variants: COVID- 19

 

 

Ekaterina Derevyanchuk, Dept. Genetics, SFU, Rostov-on-Don, Russia

Invited: NcRNAs in Sports Medicine

 

 

Ivan Martinez, Microbiology, Immunology & Cell Biology (MICB), West Virginia University (WVU) School of Medicine

Invited:  Y Chromosome LncRNAs and Radiation Sensitivity in Lung Cancer: Don’t Lose Your Maleness!

 

 

Ranjan Perera, Center for RNA Biology, Johns Hopkins University, Baltimore, MD, USA

Invited: The regulation, function, and the therapeutic potential of an oncogenic long noncoding RNA lnc-HLX-2-7 in group 3 medulloblastomas

 

 

Christopher E. Mason, Weill Cornell Medicine, New York,

Plenary: RNA dynamics and epitope changes from spaceflight and plans for Mars.

 

 

Isidore Rigoutsos, Computational Medicine Center, Thomas Jefferson University, PA.

Plenary: From Organism-specific DNA Motifs to a Colon-Cancer-Survival Biomarker and Beyond

 

 

 

2022: Las Vegas USA + Online

 

Igor Ulitsky, Weizmann Institute of Science Rehovot, Israel.

Keynote: Title: Evolution, functions, and modes of action of long noncoding RNAs.

 

 

George Calin,  UT-Houston MD Anderson Cancer Center, Houston, TX, USA

Keynote: About Chomsky, patterns, non-codingRNAs and cancer therapy.

 

 

Ivan Martinez,

MICB, WVU School of Medicine

Invited; Characterizing the Molecular Function of the Radiosensitizer Long Non-coding RNAs linc-SPRY3 in Male Lung Cancers.

 

 

David Hendrix, Biochemistry & Biophysics, Oregon State University, Corvallis, OR

Invited: Secondary Structure Global Alignment and Clustering for Improving Functional Classification and ncRNA Motif Discovery

 

 

2023: Istanbul, Turkey

 

David Corey, UT Southwestern Medical Center, Dallas, Texas, USA .

Keynote: Title: LncRNAs, Chromatin, and Gene Regulation

 

 

Sathyanarayanan V Puthanveettil, University of Florida, Jupiter, Florida, USA .

Keynote: Uncovering the Journey of lncRNAs: Building Lasting Memories through Long-Distance Transport

 

 

Ranjan Perera, Johns Hopkins University School of Medicine, Baltimore, Maryland, USA.

Plenary: Targeting the long non-coding RNA lnc-HLX-2-7 in group 3 childhood Medulloblastoma

 

 

Ivan Martinez, MICB, WVU

Invited: Human Papillomavirus Type 16 Increases Circular RNA Circ-IGF2BP3 Expression Affecting Proliferation and Migration in Cervical Cancer Cells

 

 

2024: Lisbon, Portugal

 

Francisco J. Enguita, Faculdade de Medicina, Universidade de Lisboa, Lisboa, Portugal

Keynote: LncRNAs and Human SARS-CoV-2 Interactions

 

 

Marie Puri Fortes, CIMA University of Navarra, Pamplona. Spain

Plenary: Coding and Non-coding LncRNAs in Hepatocellular Carcinoma

 

 

Leonard Lipovich, Wenzhou-Kean University, Wenzhou, China; Molecular Medicine and Genetics, WSU Detroit, Michigan, USA;

Invited: GWAS-driven characterization of primate-specific long non-coding RNA genes as causes of, and sequence-based drug targets in, cancer and diabetes

 

 

Ivan Martinez, MICB, WVU

Invited: HPV-16 Increases Expression of Long Non-coding Circular RNA circIGF2BP3 to Influence Cervical Cancer Progression

 

 

 

(4) Journal Special Issue on LncRNAs based 2021 Workshop.

MDPI Non-Coding RNA journal.

https://www.mdpi.com/journal/ncrna/special_issues/81CH217P14

 

6 papers published.

 

 

 

(5) Mini-review Paper with Opinions on current issues in LncRNA research.

Adjeroh DA, Zhou X, Paschoal AR, Dimitrova N, Derevyanchuk EG, Shkurat TP, Loeb JA, Martinez I, Lipovich L. “Challenges in LncRNA biology: Views and opinions,” Non-coding RNA. 2024 Aug 1;10(4):43.

 


Last Modified: 01/10/2025
Modified by: Donald Adjeroh
